bibl.title: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Rupert Blue, November 27, 1918

div1.p: Carter requests permission to go to Guatemala with Gorgas for yellow fever work.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Rupert Blue, November 27, 1918
div1.p:
Referring to what you were speaking of Monday, I will be
very glad to go to Guatemala with General Gorgas. I did not
understand whether you purposed for me to go under Service
orders or--having spoken to Gorgas about it--as a member of
his party on leave from the Service. This latter I judge as
otherwise I could hardly go with his party. Either way will do
so far as I am concerned. I do not want, however, to lose my
quarters during the winter, as it would be very difficult to
provide for Mrs. Carter elsewhere just now--indeed well nigh
impossible to do so in my absence. I am purposing to gokafor
Waiting Orders next spring--preferably May 5th., the 40th. an-
niversary of my entrance into the Service.

I wrote to General Gorgas, of date November 24th./18, asking
about his yellow fever plans. I saw you the 25th. inst. Have
not heard from him so far.
div1.closer: Very truly yours, Assistant Surgeon General.
